alert.note: Alert for Harney (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:31PM PDT until April 11 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boise ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Oregon... Donner Und Blitzen River Near Frenchglen affecting Harney County. .Warm daytime temperatures along with low temperatures remaining above freezing overnight will accelerate snow melt. River flows will continue to increase overnight. For the Donner Und Blitzen R...including Frenchglen...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Donner Und Blitzen River Near Frenchglen. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Floodwater will flow over portions of the access road to Page Springs Campground. At 7.0 feet, Floodwater will cover portions of the Page Springs Campground to a depth of 3 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM PDT Monday the stage was 6.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM PDT Monday was 6.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 6.5 feet tonight, then slowly fall Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.4 feet on 02/28/1972. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 830 AM PDT.
